cards.task: Stream the script execution logs in real-time
cards.description: Streams execution logs directly to your terminal, showing console.log output and errors as they occur.
cards.whenToUse: When debugging your script and you want to see logs without leaving the terminal.
scenarios: Live debugging: Watching logs while testing your script's functionality
Error monitoring: Watching for errors in a running web app
Development workflow: Viewing console.log output while developing

cards.description: Continuously monitors and displays new log entries as they occur, refreshing every 5 seconds.
cards.whenToUse: When debugging a running script or monitoring production web app activity.
scenarios: Live debugging: Watching logs while triggering your web app
Production monitoring: Keeping logs open to watch for errors
Trigger testing: Monitoring logs while time-based triggers fire

cards.task: View logs in JSON format for parsing
cards.description: Outputs logs as JSON instead of human-readable format for programmatic processing.
cards.whenToUse: When integrating logs with monitoring tools or parsing them programmatically.
scenarios: Log aggregation: Piping JSON logs to Elasticsearch or Splunk
Automated analysis: Using jq to filter and analyze error patterns
CI/CD testing: Parsing JSON logs in test scripts

cards.description: Removes timestamps and metadata from log output, showing only the actual messages.
cards.whenToUse: When you only care about the log messages themselves.
scenarios: Quick scanning: Removing clutter to quickly scan for error messages
Copy-paste: Getting clean log messages for documentation
Pattern matching: Easier to spot repeated messages without noise

cards.task: Open the Apps Script execution logs in browser
cards.description: Opens the Stackdriver Logging page where you can view detailed execution logs.
cards.whenToUse: When you need the full web interface for complex log filtering.
scenarios: Detailed debugging: Accessing the full web interface for complex analysis
Historical review: Viewing execution logs from days or weeks ago
Log export: Using the web interface to export logs for reporting

cards.task: Execute a function in the script
cards.description: Remotely executes a specific function in your Apps Script project from the command line.
cards.whenToUse: When you want to test functions or run one-off scripts without the editor.
scenarios: Function testing: Running and testing individual functions during development
One-off tasks: Executing data migration or cleanup functions
CI/CD integration: Running test functions in automated pipelines

cards.task: Open the Google Cloud Console for the project
cards.description: Opens the Google Cloud Platform Console for your script's associated cloud project.
cards.whenToUse: When you need to manage advanced cloud settings, view API quotas, or configure OAuth.
scenarios: Quota management: Checking API usage limits and requesting increases
OAuth configuration: Setting up consent screens for add-ons
Service accounts: Creating service accounts for server-to-server auth
